The Portrait orientation choice of LCD screen is available only when the the parameter 'Active Height'(set in LTDC IP) is greater than 'Active Width'(set in LTDC IP).

RefParameter.Name: EW_Frame_Buffer_Width
RefParameter.Description: Specify physical display horizontal size of the LCD framebuffer.

RefParameter.Name: EW_Frame_Buffer_Height

RefParameter.Name: EW_Frame_Buffer_Depth

RefParameter.Name: EW_Frame_Buffer_Depth_Param

RefParameter.Name: EW_Frame_Buffer_Depth

RefParameter.Name: EW_Memory_Pool_Size
RefParameter.Description:
Configures the memory pool size value allocated for the stack .
Warning:
If the memory pool size value is small , the stack may not have enough memory to make allocations.
< For information :
MEMORY_POOL_SIZE = 0x800000(Default value can be set from this parameter) - FRAME_BUFFER_SIZE - DOUBLE_BUFFER_SIZE.
< FRAME_BUFFER_SIZE = X size * Y size * Frame Buffer Depth.
< DOUBLE_BUFFER_SIZE = FRAME_BUFFER_SIZE.

RefParameter.Name: EW_Memory_Pool_Size
RefParameter.Description:
Configures the memory pool size value allocated for the stack .
Warning:
If the memory pool size value is small , the stack may not have enough memory to make allocations.
< For information :
MEMORY_POOL_SIZE = 0x800000(Default value can be set from this parameter) - FRAME_BUFFER_SIZE - DOUBLE_BUFFER_SIZE.
< FRAME_BUFFER_SIZE = X size * Y size * Frame Buffer Depth.
< DOUBLE_BUFFER_SIZE = FRAME_BUFFER_SIZE.

RefParameter.Name: EW_Frame_Buffer_Address
RefParameter.Description: The color frame buffer address must be set from LTDC configuration.

RefParameter.Name: EW_Color_FrameBuffer_StartAdress_DBI
RefParameter.Description: Configures the color frame buffer address.

RefParameter.Name: EW_USE_FREERTOS
RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the usage of the FREERTOS : select whether to use a library compiled to run in a multi-task environment.

RefParameter.Name: EW_Buffer_Synchronization_Method
RefParameter.Description: Select the buffer synchronization method.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Enable or Disable the usage of an additional framebuffer, so that the screen is operated in double-buffering mode
Enable or Disable the usage of an off-screenbuffer. This is an internal buffer, allocated by the Graphics Engine and used to prepare the graphical content (composition buffer)
Enable or Disable the usage of a small scratch-pad buffer used for the graphics composition instead of a framebuffer.As a result the screen of the display is updated in partial mode.

RefParameter.Name: EW_USE_DOUBLE_BUFFER
RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the usage of an additional framebuffer, so that the screen is operated in double-buffering mode .

RefParameter.Name: EW_USE_DOUBLE_BUFFER
RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the usage of an additional framebuffer, so that the screen is operated in double-buffering mode .

RefParameter.Name: EW_USE_OFFSCREEN_BUFFER
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable the usage of an off-screenbuffer .
< For information :
This is an internal buffer, allocated by the Graphics Engine and used to prepare the graphical content (composition buffer).

RefParameter.Name: EW_USE_OFFSCREEN_BUFFER
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable the usage of an off-screenbuffer .
< For information :
This is an internal buffer, allocated by the Graphics Engine and used to prepare the graphical content (composition buffer).

RefParameter.Name: EW_USE_SCRATCHPAD_BUFFER
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable the usage of a small scratch-pad buffer used for the graphics composition instead of a framebuffer.As a result the screen of the display is updated in partial mode.
< For information :
This mode is used to reduce the memory footprint to a minimum, but it may cause some tearing or flickering effects.
< It is useful in combination with displays containing its own graphics memory (GRAM).

RefParameter.Name: EW_USE_SCRATCHPAD_BUFFER
RefParameter.Description:
Enable or Disable the usage of a small scratch-pad buffer used for the graphics composition instead of a framebuffer.As a result the screen of the display is updated in partial mode.
< For information :
This mode is used to reduce the memory footprint to a minimum, but it may cause some tearing or flickering effects.
< It is useful in combination with displays containing its own graphics memory (GRAM).

RefParameter.Name: EW_MCU_LOAD_MEASURING
RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the usage of the CPU load measurements.

RefParameter.Name: EW_SURFACE_ROTATION
RefParameter.Description: Select the rotation of the screen.

RefParameter.Comment: Color Frame Buffer Start Address(Set in LTDC)
RefParameter.Name: EW_FrameBuffer_StartAddress_DPI_DSI
RefParameter.Description: The color frame buffer address must be set from LTDC configuration.

Select the color format of the Graphics Engine .
Warning:
The selection of the color format must be equals to the selection of the format color with the Embedded Wizard Studio.
< The color format of the Graphics Engine depends of the LTDC Pixel format (Configured from LTDC configuration).

EW_MAX_GLYPH_SURFACE_HEIGHT
RefParameter.Description:
Specify the glyph surface height.
< For information :
The glyph surface is an alpha8 surface, where all rasterized glyphs are stored. It is a kind of cache.

RefParameter.Name: EW_MAX_GLYPH_SURFACE_WIDTH
RefParameter.Description:
Specify the glyph surface width.
< For information :
The glyph surface is an alpha8 surface, where all rasterized glyphs are stored. It is a kind of cache.

RefParameter.Description: Select the surface cache size.

RefParameter.Name: EW_MAX_SURFACE_CACHE_SIZE
RefParameter.Description: Select the surface cache size.

RefParameter.Description: Specify physical display horizontal size.

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_Buffer_Height
RefParameter.Description: Specify the physical display vertical size.

RefParameter.Description: The color frame buffer address must be set from LTDC configuration.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: LTDC Pixel Format L8 , AL44 , AL88 , ARGB1555 , ARGB4444 and ARGB8888 are not compatible with TouchGFX Color Format

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_depth
RefParameter.Description: The color frame buffer depth depends on the current selection of the Frame buffer color format parameter.

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_depth
RefParameter.Description: The color frame buffer depth depends on the current selection of the Frame buffer color format parameter.

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_depth
RefParameter.Description: The color frame buffer depth depends on the current selection of the Frame buffer color format parameter.

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Error in frame buffer color format parameter

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_cache_Address
RefParameter.Description:
Bitmaps cache location.
< For information :
The bitmap cache address shouldn't overlap with the framebuffer region.
Cache Addres = Frame Buffer Address + (Width * Height * (bitdepth / 8))*3.

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_cache_size
RefParameter.Description: Spicify the bitmap cache size.

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_cache_count
RefParameter.Description: Spicify max count of objects to store in cache.

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_buffers_count
RefParameter.Description: Buffers Count

RefParameter.Name: TGFX_buffers_count
RefParameter.Description: Buffers Count

BspDependency.Name: LCD Reset Pin XRES
BspDependency.Comment: Configure the GPIO on PH7 for STM32F469I-DISCO , on PK7 for STM32F469I-EVAL , on PK15 for STM32F769I-DISCO and on PK7 for STM32F769I-EVAL

Condition.Diagnostic: STemWin is active only when CRC IP and (FMC SRAM IP configured with memory type in LCD interface mode) or (FMC SDRAM IP and (LTDC IP or LTDC IP (DSI mode) and DSIHOST IP (TE mode)) ) are configured
STemWin is active only when CRC IP and (FMC SRAM IP configured with memory type in LCD interface mode) or ( LTDC IP or (LTDC IP (DSI mode) and DSIHOST IP (TE mode))) are configured
STemWin is active only when CRC IP and (FMC SRAM IP configured with memory type in LCD interface mode) or (FMC SDRAM IP and (LTDC IP or LTDC IP (DSI mode) and DSIHOST IP (TE mode)) ) are configured
Embedded Wizard is active only when FMC SDRAM IP ,DMA2D IP and (LTDC IP or LTDC IP (DSI mode) and DSIHOST IP (TE mode)) are configured

Condition.Expression: ((MW_LTDC_MW & MW_DSIHOST_MW )| (MW_LTDC_MW) ) & CRC & (S_FREERTOS) & (SdramChipSelect2|SdramChipSelect1) & (MW_DMA2D_MW) & ( (TIM1 & TIM1_Exist) | (TIM2 & TIM2_Exist) | (TIM3 & TIM3_Exist) | (TIM4 & TIM4_Exist) | (TIM5 & TIM5_Exist) | (TIM6 & TIM6_Exist) | (TIM7 & TIM7_Exist) | (TIM8 & TIM8_Exist) | (TIM9 & TIM9_Exist) | (TIM10 & TIM10_Exist) | (TIM11 & TIM11_Exist) | (TIM12 & TIM12_Exist) | (TIM13 & TIM13_Exist) | (TIM14 & TIM14_Exist) | (TIM15 & TIM15_Exist) | (TIM16 & TIM16_Exist) | (TIM17 & TIM17_Exist) | (TIM18 & TIM18_Exist) | (TIM19 & TIM19_Exist) | (TIM20 & TIM20_Exist) | (TIM21 & TIM21_Exist) | (TIM22 & TIM22_Exist) | (TIM23 & TIM23_Exist) )
Condition.Diagnostic: TouchGFX is active only when FreeRTOS ,DMA2D IP , CRC IP , FMC SDRAM IP , TIM IP and (LTDC IP or LTDC IP (DSI mode) and DSIHOST IP (TE mode)) are configured

Condition.Expression: ((MW_LTDC_MW & MW_DSIHOST_MW )| (MW_LTDC_MW) ) & CRC & (S_FREERTOS) & (SdramChipSelect2|SdramChipSelect1) & (MW_DMA2D_MW) & ( (TIM1 & TIM1_Exist) | (TIM2 & TIM2_Exist) | (TIM3 & TIM3_Exist) | (TIM4 & TIM4_Exist) | (TIM5 & TIM5_Exist) | (TIM6 & TIM6_Exist) | (TIM7 & TIM7_Exist) | (TIM8 & TIM8_Exist) | (TIM9 & TIM9_Exist) | (TIM10 & TIM10_Exist) | (TIM11 & TIM11_Exist) | (TIM12 & TIM12_Exist) | (TIM13 & TIM13_Exist) | (TIM14 & TIM14_Exist) | (TIM15 & TIM15_Exist) | (TIM16 & TIM16_Exist) | (TIM17 & TIM17_Exist) | (TIM18 & TIM18_Exist) | (TIM19 & TIM19_Exist) | (TIM20 & TIM20_Exist) | (TIM21 & TIM21_Exist) | (TIM22 & TIM22_Exist) | (TIM23 & TIM23_Exist) )
Condition.Diagnostic: TouchGFX is active only when FreeRTOS ,DMA2D IP , CRC IP , FMC SDRAM IP , TIM IP and (LTDC IP or LTDC IP (DSI mode) and DSIHOST IP (TE mode)) are configured
Active only when one stack is selected and LTDC IP is configured in DSI mode ,DSIHOST IP is configured in TE Pin and at least FMC SDRAM IP is configured
Active only when one stack is selected and LTDC IP is configured in DSI mode ,DSIHOST IP is configured in TE Pin mode and GFXMMU IP is configured
Active only when one stack is selected ,LTDC IP is configured and at least FMC SDRAM IP is configured
Active only when one stack is selected and LTDC IP is configured
Active only when STemWin is selected and at least one FMC SRAM IP configured with memory type in LCD interface mode
